definitions.definition: to experience and deal with something that is painful or unpleasant without giving up
definitions.sensetop: endure somethingendure doing somethingendure to do something

examples.text: They had to endure a long wait before the case came to trial.
She could not endure the thought of parting.
The pain was almost too great to endure.
a love that endures all things and never fails
They had to endure the racist taunts of the crowd.
He can't endure to be defeated.

definitions.definition: to continue to exist for a long time

examples.text: The torn flag has endured as a symbol of freedom.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French endurer, from Latin indurare ‘harden’, from in- ‘in’ + durus ‘hard’.
